mods.note: ^9 Kuscfl t , 8tVi Jc'jnucr^ 1936. To His Hlghncea oaiyid Cold bin Taimur, Multan of Muscat and Orion. Your Highness, 1 hove the honour to inform Your Highness that the Siamese Government -Naval Training ship 'Chao Phyo' which proceeded on o cruise to Italy in November last is now on her way bacJc to Siam. She is accompanied by two torpedo boats constructed in Italy for the Siamese Government and proposes to call at Murbot about the ?Oth January for the purpose of transferring fuel ond taking water. They have selected Kurbat os a convenient point os the process of transferring coal could not be effected at open sea. fe the vessels will leave Murbnt on the same day and the crew do not intend to land there no facilities will be required. Your Highness*s sincere friend, Major, Political -gent & H.B.M’s Consul,MuscatM Letter dated Dhofar 17th Shawal 1354 ( ) from His Highness Saiyid Said bin Tairaur, Sultan of Muscat & Oman, to Major R.P.Watts, Political Agent & H.B.M's Consul,Muscot• ■ iq A.C. I acknowledge the receipt of your letter No.C/9 dated 8th January 1936 regarding the Siamese Naval Training ship »VHfiO ?////* Qn( i thank you for the information contained there in. TJ. E. Impending visit of certain Siamese .var vessels to Mur bat.P.Z.9265/35. r* INDIA OFFICE, WHITEHALL, S.W.l. 28th Decemher, 1935• / / Sir, fith reference to your letter of the 6th Decemher, No.Fo7638/923/40 and connected correspondence regarding the impending visit of certain Siamese war vessels to Murhat, I am directed by the Secretary of State for India to forward for the information of the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs a copy of a telegram addressed by the Political Agent, Muscat, to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, from which it will be seen that appropriate action has been taken, 2 C The Marquess of Zetland assumes that Mr. Eden will now take steps to inform the Siamese Legation that the necessary notification has been made to the Government of His Highness the Sultan of Muscat, in whose territory Murbat is situated* 3 . Copies of this letter are being sent to the Colonial Office, Admiralty, and Air Ministry. I am, Sir, Your obedient Servant, Qf |i- Hi*\ <ti/‘A he Under Secretary of State, Foreign Office, S.W.l. . CttPY3679a INDIA OFFICE, POLITICAL Department. EXPRESS LETTER (AIR MAIL). (N.B.—This is an original message, sent by air mail to save telegraphic expense, but intended to be treated on receipt with the same expedition as if it had been telegraphed. It has been drafted as if it were so despatched.) From Secretary of State for India To Political Resident, Bushire, repeated to Government of India Foreign & Political Department, and Political Agent.,l’ r uscat Dated 3rd February, 1937. Pleasy refer to India Office Express Letter of 13th December, 1935, lie. P.Z'.8777/35 and connected correspondence regarding the visit of certain Siamese war vessels to Murbai while en route from Italy to Siam. S. I now enclose copy of a letter dated 21st January from the Foreign Office with enclosures concerning the impending visit of the Siamese Saval Transport M Angthong n to Italy for the purpose of taking- delivery of more new war vessels which have been constructed in that country for the Siamese Uavy. You will note that crews are being sent from Siam to man the new warships and that on the journey to Siam calls will be made at Cherbitat (presumably Fcas Sharbatat) and/or Murbat (a reference to the latter being made in paragraph 1 of the Siamese State Councillors letter of 26th December, 1936). 3* In connection with the earlier visit referred to in paragraph 1 above, it was stated that the vessels merely desired to take shelter at Murbat for the purpose of transferring fuel. Presumably the forthcoming visits will be of a similar nature, necessitating merely a formal notification to the Muscat Government. Unless you see any objection, please instruct the political Agent, Muscat, to take action similar to that reported in his telegram Ho.218 of the 26th December 1935, and telegraph when he has done so. The issue of the above has been duly authorised. (Sgd.) M. J. Name and Date. India Office P.Z* 13b.1508/37, dated 8th March, to Foreign Offic Subject. Proposed visit of the Siamese Ifeval Transport '■AUGTHORG* to Italy.x . Z. 1508/37 8th March, 1937. Sir, With reference to your letter of the 21st January 1937, No.P.164/164/40 regarding the proposed visit of the Siamese Naval Transport 'Augthong' to Italy for the purpose of taking delivery of new war vessels which have heen constructed in that country for the Siamese Navy, I am directed hy the Secretary of State for India to refer to the telegram No. 19 dated 4th March 1937, addressed hy the Political Agent, Muscat, to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf (copy of which was enclosed with India Office Printed Letter No.P.Z. 1508/37 dated 6th March), from which it will he seen that the appropriate action has heen taken in so far as the visits to Muscat territory are concerned. 2. The Marquess of Zetland assumes that Mr. Eden will now take steps to inform the Siamese Government that the necessary notification has heen made to the Government of His Highness the Sultan' of Muscat, in whose territory Has Sharhatat and Murhqt are situated. 3, Copies of this letter are being sent to the Admiralty and the Colonial Office. I am, Sir, Your obedient Servant, The Under Secretary of State, Foreign Office, S. W. 1. PPNT TOCONFIDENTIAL. ISV 332-3 of 1937. The Hon’ble the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf presents his compliments to The Political Agent, Muscat, and has the honour to transmit to him a copy of the undermentioned documents British Consnlate-Gtnerai, BUSHIRE. Dated...!-.?.?. 1 ?. May . I?,??. Reference to previous correspondence : Residency Printed letter No.c/5 of the 5th March 193 3, Description of Enclosure. Name and Date. Subject. Foreign Office deep tch No. 44 of the 12th March 1937 to Bangkok. Visit of to Siamese vessels Murbat.Copy. No.44. FOREIGN OFFICE,S . V.l. (E 1424/164/40). 12th March, 1957. Sir, In the note from the Siamese State Councillor for Foreign Affairs, of .vhich a copy was enclosed in your despatch No. 513 (23/223/36) of the 28th December, 1936, it was stated that the *Angthong’* was to accompany three torpedo boats between Aden amd Mur bat* And in the schd ules accompanying that note calls at Cherbitat were specified. It was presumed that the later is identical with Has Sharbatat, which, like Murbat, lies within the territory of the Sultan of Muscat. 2. As it appeared unlikely that the Siamese Government would have c orrnuni cat ed direct with the Muscat Government, a copy of your despatch under reference was transmitted to the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf. O n his instructions the Political Agent at Muscat has now notified the Sultan of the forthcoming visits.. I shall be glad if you will inform the Siamese Government accordingly. I am, with great truth and regard, Sir, Your obedient servant, sd. C.Y.Orde. Sir Josiah Crosby, KB.E., C.I.E. etc* , etc., etc. Bangk o&. COPY SEN r TO I Niff Ak% P. a. 3799/37. Ho. F. 3186/164/40. The Under Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs presents his compliments to the Under Secretary of State for India and# by direction of the Secretary of State transmits herewith copies of the undermentioned paper# Foreign Office# June 10th, 1937 Reference to previous correspondence: I.Q. letter P.S. 1508/37* 3th March. Rescription of Enclosure# Name and Pate Subject ^ H.M# Representative# Bangkok, No.166# 27th April. Siamese Navy.NO.166 British Legation, (SOC/E5/37). Bangkok. April 27th,1937. Sir, With reference to Foreign Office despatch No.44 (F•1424/164/40) of March 12th last I have the honour to enclose herewith copy of a Note addressed to me on the 24th instant by the Acting Minister of Foreign Affairs on the subject of the visit of H.S.M.S. 'Angthong' to Ras Sharbatat, asking that an expression of the sincere tlianks of the Ministry of Defence may be conveyed to those authorities, such as the iolitical Residents at Muscat and on the Persian Gulf, who lent their assistance and good offices in connexion with the proposed itinerary of the Siamese war vessels in so far as it concerned the Sultanate of Muscat. I have &c., (Sd.) J. Crosby. The Right Honourable Anthony E]den,r .C. ,M.C. ,M.± ., etc., etc., etc._ - S* kk (Copy) No.931/2480 Ministry of Foreign Affairs Saranromya ialace. 24th April,1937. Monsieur le Ministre, I have the honour to acknowledge the receipt of Your ;iaccellency«s letter 200/11/37 of the 24th ultimo, by which, under instructions from your Government, Your ijjccellency was good enough to inform me, in connection with H.M.S.Angthong 1 s schedule, that it has been presumed that the port of 'Cherbitat” appearing therein is identical with Has Sharbatat, vtfiich, like Murbat, lies within the territory of the Sultan of Muscat. In these circumstances, notification of the movements of the 'Angthong” was^nade to the British iolitical Resident in the lersian Gulf and, on the instructions of the latter, the Political Resident at Muscat has notified the Sultan of Muscat of the forthcoming visits. I have duly referred the matter to the Ministry of Defence who, in confirming to me the correctness of the above-mentioned presumption, request me to convey to Your Excellency, and through Your Excellency to the British Authorities concerned, an expression of their sincere thanks for their courteous assistance and good offices in this matter. I avail myself of this opportunity, Monsieur le Ministre, to renew to Your Excellency the assurance of ray highest consideration. (Sd.) LUANG PIBULASONGGHAM Acting for Minister of Foreign Affairs His Excellency Sir Josiah Crosby,1C.B.£. ,C. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 9-B/4 Naval and Shipping: Visit of Siam's Training Ship'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order, from the front to the rear.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 32; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-31; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: Correspondence concerning the visits of Siamese (Thai) naval vessels to Mirbat on the Omani coast. The papers mostly consist of notices given for the visits and the communication of thanks for assistance given. The vessels concerned are Chao Phyaand Angthong. Correspondence comes from: the Political Agency, Muscat; the Political Residency in the Persian Gulf; the India Office; the British Legation, Bangkok; the Foreign Office; Said bin Taimur [Sa‘īd bin Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd], the Sultan of Muscat; and officials of the Government of Siam.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
